lexUnit.name: simmer.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: stay or cause to stay just below boiling point while bubbling gently

sentence.text: Cover and simmer the chicken for 15-20 minutes , until tender .
Simmer the chicken for a further 10-15 minutes until the chicken is tender .
Simmer the aubergines in a large pan of water until just cooked , about 10min , or cook , covered , in the microwave for 7-8min or until just tender .
Simmer aubergine in boiling water for 8 minutes .
Gently simmer the courgettes , mushrooms , onion and herbs in water for 10 minutes .
Simmer the onion , garlic , celery leaves and tomatoes in the fish stock for 10 minutes then add the swordfish .
Natural stomachs are not often used now and the casing should be well pricked before the haggis is simmered in a pan of water for 30-40 min .
Crammed with sausage , potatoes , eggs , bread and ham , the pig 's innards are simmered in salt water for three hours .
Pass through a sieve and simmer the juice gently to remove most of the water .
Simmer the onion and garlic in the tomatoes , herbs and black pepper .
Add parsley and simmer for 15 mins .
Boil for 5 minutes on gentle heat then add mushroom -- and simmer in a covered saucepan for a further 7 minutes .
Simmer gently until apple has softened .
